channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Creativity is as important as data literacy in the AI era, says IBM exec
item.description: Human ingenuity and a willingness to experiment are now vital for advancing in the AI economy.

item.title: How Banning Salary Histories Narrows Gender and Racial Pay Gaps
item.description: A new study shows bans on employers asking prospective employees about pay history have helped women and minorities land higher salaries at their new ...

item.title: New York’s ubiquitous construction scaffolding gets a glow up
item.description: New York City scaffolding is so commonplace it has become a kind of extra architectural skin covering the city. It’s estimated that there are more tha...

item.title: Consumers Plan Broad Support for Small Business Saturday
item.description: A survey showed people are eager to support local entrepreneurs as the make-or-break holiday shopping season approaches.

item.title: Johor is building a 7300-acre innovation hub on the Singapore border, offering ‘land and scale’ for its neighbor’s ‘capital and speed’
item.description: Johor doesn't have the building blocks for innovation, Datuk Syed Mohamed Syed Ibrahim, JCorp's CEO, explained. “But in Singapore, there are.”

item.title: Timothée Chalamet’s best role yet is your weirdly intense coworker on Zoom
item.description: Timothée Chalamet just posted an 18-minute-long video to his Instagram to promote his upcoming A24 film , Marty Supreme . It might be his best role ye...

item.title: Why vibe coding is a leadership problem, not a technical one
item.description: Spend a few minutes on developer Twitter and you’ll run into it: “vibe coding.” With a name like that, it might sound like a passing internet trend, b...

item.title: Your Gen-Z Marketing Strategy Is Insulting Their Intelligence
item.description: Brands are still marketing to Gen Z like they’re idiots. Here’s how to treat them as the sophisticated consumers they are.

item.title: The IRS Is Facing a Huge Backlog After the Government Shutdown. What It Means for Businesses
item.description: Here’s what to know if you are in a dispute with the IRS or waiting for a refund—and how delays could impact next year’s tax deadlines.

item.title: More Big Tech company debt ‘would increase the macro risks associated with the AI build-out,’ Goldman Sachs warns
item.description: Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, and Oracle have taken on $121 billion in new debt, year-to-date—quadruple the amount from the prior five years.

item.title: How ‘good enough’ products are disrupting premium pricing
item.description: Strategy textbooks taught us that sustainable competitive advantage that commanded premium prices was best protected by powerful barriers to entry . B...

item.title: Stuut raises $29.5 million Series A led by Andreessen Horowitz to automate accounts receivable
item.description: Stuut has raised a $29.5 million Series A, led by Andreessen Horowitz, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Nvidia Just Revived the AI Trade
item.description: Nvidia reported another quarter of record-beating earnings.

item.title: Tariff threats and Gen Z sobriety have put winemakers in Bordeaux on red alert
item.description: French wine production has plummeted to 60-year lows, as trade wars and changing drinking habits hurt sales.

item.title: Dr. Martens just made the classic rain boot a whole lot more punk
item.description: Here’s the thing about Wellington boots: They’re great when it’s raining, because they keep your toes dry and toasty. But when the rain stops, you fee...
